31aa88fcc9d4fcb2c71348bf7d399fc4 (01:17): to anyone who knows ... with System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LinearGradientBrush ... what is the best way to fill a path using multiple stops? i.e. a rainbow for instance
9a7c07c053d564a9449e407a16e74ef5 (01:23): Sfckwoop: look at ColorBlend or Blend
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:27): annnyone know how to get the root of the project or something?
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:28): path that is
9a7c07c053d564a9449e407a16e74ef5 (01:28): gaillard_: root of the project?
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:28): I can find something
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:28): I just found a burrito
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:28): mmm burrito

62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:29): all i need to do is dataset.writexml(somewhere) and then later be able to read in a relative manner it back into a dataset in case the project folder is moved
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:29): which happens a lot
9a7c07c053d564a9449e407a16e74ef5 (01:29): gaillard_: if you use a relative path in writexml then the path will be relative to the current working directory
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:30): . works fine
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:30): but that is a volatile place isn't it?
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:30): needs to stay on rebuild
9a7c07c053d564a9449e407a16e74ef5 (01:31): so set it to copy to the output folder when building
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:31): why are you running production source on a dev machine
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:32): kog how else should I set it up?
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:32): KeeperOfTheSoul: ok
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:32): it depends entirely on what your app does
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:33): we're all ignorant
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:33): just a question of what we do about it
31aa88fcc9d4fcb2c71348bf7d399fc4 (01:35): KeeperOfTheSoul: ty very much!
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:35): but, it should be pretty obvious that you don't want to run whatever app it is out of the build directory
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:35): that's just asking for trouble
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:37): well i am still developing
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:37): so what do you mean?
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:38): while I am developing my project folder moves a lot depending on where i am
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:38): so i can't be using absolute paths, i am sure there is some standard way just can't find it
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:38): resources doesn't seem to work for this
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:38): you can either run it in a static place (IE \\foo\bar) or relative
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:38): because if i make this xml file a resource when i do Properties.thexmlfile it gives me a darn string
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:38): static place?
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:39): its relative to what though, ALWAYS the bin/Debug folder
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:39): no
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:39): its just an xml not something to run
edfb3a72abbb7ecf6e8f40e7ba7a3bab (01:39): how do i use a datagrid?
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:39): b0lt: go find a tutorial
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:39): b0lt: msdn
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:39): gaillard_: first of all you
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:40): you're not going to deploy to bin/debug on your target env
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:40): so, think of it as relative to your deployment
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:40): hmm ok
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:40): not entirely sure what you're writing out, but it's entirely kosher to shove it relative to the bin dir
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:40): IE bin\blah
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:41): which yes, isn't persistent across builds
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:41): I guess KeeperOfTheSoul's suggestion to just copy is fine for now then for development
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:41): because it's not meant to be run out of the build dir
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:41): kog ya i see
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:41): it's a trivial problem to solve, and you're going to need to solve it
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:41): do it now
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:41): don't wait until 20 minutes before deadline
9a7c07c053d564a9449e407a16e74ef5 (01:42): what's the difference between running from the output dir, or running from some other dir?
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:43): people's perception of structure
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:43): kog hehe this isn't a schoold thing :P
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:43): ok, if you have no deadlines in your open source work so be it
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:44): but by the time you slog through getting all your shit working, the last thing you're going to want to do is fuck with the release mechanism
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (01:44): and getting the release process done early ensures clean results
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:45): very good point
9a7c07c053d564a9449e407a16e74ef5 (01:45): oh, I just always have it so the final output dir contains the complete thing ready for release
62904c4a209ec26b3fbb74df751a83ed (01:46): that would be quite frustrating :(
